contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Matsushima'''|松島町|Matsushima-machi}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Amakusa District, Kumamoto|Amakusa District]], [[Kumamoto Prefecture|Kumamoto]], [[Japan]]. On March 31, 2004 Matsushima was merged with the towns of [[Himedo, Kumamoto|Himedo]], [[Ōyano, Kumamoto|Ōyano]] and [[Ryugatake, Kumamoto|Ryūgatake]], all from [[Amakusa District, Kumamoto|Amakusa District]], to form the new city of [[Kami-Amakusa, Kumamoto|Kami-Amakusa]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipalities of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 8,711 and a [[population density|density]] of 170.14 persons per km². The total area was 51.20 km². ==External links== * [http://www.kamiamakusa-c.kumamoto-sgn.jp/ Official website of Kami-Amakusa] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Kumamoto Prefecture]] {{Kumamoto-geo-stub}}
